answers.author: Kelly LeRoux
answers.text:
As a very general rule, its often easiest to start with services that can be easily measured and monitoring through clear performance expectations (ie. the "hard" services like snow removal, street sweeping, refuse and recycling, etc.). Of course you have to take into consideration first what the local market looks like - are there private providers in the area that have the expertise and capacity to get a pool of competitive bids. On that note, its also its a good idea to review your procurement code to make it sure it allows for competitive negotiation, so that you aren't locked into accepting the lowest bid.
